TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IBoundAuthorizationHeaderProvider

Docs.summary: Creates an authorization header value that the caller can use to access a protected web API, which supports either unbound or bound to a certificate (for example, in an mTLS PoP scenario) tokens.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.OperationResult<Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.AuthorizationHeaderInformation,Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.AuthorizationHeaderError>> CreateBoundAuthorizationHeaderAsync (Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.DownstreamApiOptions downstreamApiOptions, System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal? claimsPrincipal = default, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<valuetype Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.OperationResult`2<class Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.AuthorizationHeaderInformation, class Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.AuthorizationHeaderError>> CreateBoundAuthorizationHeaderAsync(class Microsoft.Identity.Abstractions.DownstreamApiOptions downstreamApiOptions, class System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal claimsPrincipal, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Public Function CreateBoundAuthorizationHeaderAsync (downstreamApiOptions As DownstreamApiOptions, Optional claimsPrincipal As ClaimsPrincipal = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of OperationResult(Of AuthorizationHeaderInformation, AuthorizationHeaderError))

Docs.param: Information about the API that will be called and token acquisition options.

Inbound authentication elements. In a web API, this is usually the result of the validation of a token. In a web app, this would be information about the signed-in user. This is not useful in daemon applications. In Microsoft.Identity.Web you rarely need to provide this parameter as it's inferred from the context.
Docs.summary: Creates the authorization header used to call a protected web API with either unbound or bound to certificate tokens.
Docs.returns: A result which contains authorization token with optional bound certificate
